title: Donald Trump’s best friend blasts president’s ‘shameless’ desertion of Kurdish allies
text:
One of Donald Trump’s strongest supporters, South Carolina Senator Lindsey Graham, right, has condemned the president’s ‘shameless’ decision to pull US troops out of Northern Syria, leaving Kurdish allies at the mercy of hostile Turkish forces (Pictures: AP)

One of Donald Trump’s most loyal supporters has launched an excoriating attack on the president’s ‘shameless’ decision to abandon America’s Kurdish allies.

South Carolina Senator Lindsey Graham tweeted Wednesday: ‘If media reports are accurate and Turkey has entered northern Syria — a disaster is in the making.

‘Pray for our Kurdish allies who have been shamelessly abandoned by the Trump Administration. This move ensures the reemergence of ISIS.

‘Will lead effort in Congress to make Erdogan pay a heavy price.’

Graham added: ‘I urge President Trump to change course while there is still time by going back to the safe zone concept that was working.’

Smoke rises from the town of Ras al-Ain in Syria’s Hasakeh province after it was bombed by Turkey on Wednesday (Picture: AFP)

The Republican politician’s blistering attack on President Trump is a marked departure for Graham

He previously defended Trump through dozens of dramas that have dogged the president’s time in the White House.

Washington DC insiders have claimed the two men have not spoken since Monday, when Trump announced his plans.

Graham was moved to speak out after President Trump pulled US troops out of Northern Syria, where they had been working alongside allied Kurdish forces, known as the YPG.

That area has since been invaded by Turkey, with which it shares a border, leaving the Kurds at the mercy of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

Erdogan considers the YPG a terrorist organization, and has repeatedly resisted calls by the Kurds for their own autonomous region.

On Monday, Trump tweeted a bloodcurdling threat to Erdogan in an apparent attempt to warn the Turkish leader off attacking the curds.

He wrote: ‘As I have stated strongly before, and just to reiterate, if Turkey does anything that I, in my great and unmatched wisdom, consider to be off limits,

‘I will totally destroy and obliterate the Economy of Turkey (I’ve done before!).

‘They must, with Europe and others, watch over the captured ISIS fighters and families.

‘The U.S. has done far more than anyone could have ever expected, including the capture of 100% of the ISIS Caliphate.

‘It is time now for others in the region, some of great wealth, to protect their own territory. THE USA IS GREAT!’

The YPG have been credited for helping to obliterate Isis strongholds in Northern Syria, and keep the terror group from reforming.

Strategists say Trump’s decision to pull US troops out of the region will likely lead to a resurgence in Isis activity, and puts the world at higher risk of associated terror attacks.

Erdogan insists he wants to maintain a safe zone in Northern Syria. Critics have long accused him of trying to impose an Islamist, authoritarian regime on his secular nation.
description: South Carolina Senator Lindsey Graham - who has repeatedly defended Trump's most outlandish behavior - has finally gone on the attack after Trump pulled troops out of Northern Syria
